subject: Re: [junit] using JUnit for the existing project
msgSnippet: ... Start writing tests... Seriously, there are several approaches to testing code that is already written.  One popular approach is to start by writing a test
messageBody:
On Tuesday 18 January 2005 04:14, manjula_g_2001 wrote:
> Hello,
>
>
> Â  Can any body tell me,how can i use the junit to test my project
> which already has so many classes in it.

Start writing tests...

Seriously, there are several approaches to testing code that is already
written. One popular approach is to start by writing a test that exposes a
known bug then fix your code to make the test pass.

You could Google for "test legacy code". One of the hits I got there was a
good page on Ward's WIKI at http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?UnitTestingLegacyCode.

--
Jason Rogers

"I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I,
but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in
the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved
me, and gave himself for me."
Galatians 2:20
